f24d2156-c7fc-4ac6-a296-efe8298f4de4.description: Earners of this badge have quickly responded to a changed teaching workplace environment and demonstrated a positive and agile approach to transition. Earners have implemented the following strategies to maintain the teaching environment in a remote format: development of skills and knowledge in remote communication technologies; facilitating student and team collaboration; conducting or facilitating remote classes; conducting or facilitating assessment; and maintaining compliance requirements.
f24d2156-c7fc-4ac6-a296-efe8298f4de4.name: Remote Delivery Transition

alignments.name: Core skills for work developmental framework

badge_template_activities.title: Develop skills in remote communication technologies including the use of some or all of the following: StudentWeb, WIZIQ, Echo 360, SKYPE, Microsoft Teams
Demonstrate ability to continue to deliver or facilitate training in a remote environment
Demonstrate ability to conduct assessment in a remote environment
Endorsement of skill implementation by Dean or Executive Director.

61d83fa6-51b5-4331-8d58-269e90c6d395.description: Earners of this badge have attained knowledge of the body's ability to maintain temperature regulation and identify deviations. Earners are able to provide an objective assessment of skills to accurately and safely assess human temperature whilst adhering to safety protocols. Earners can apply PPE (personal protective equipment), introduce self to individual and use the thermometer appropriately. Earners have the knowledge to interpret and action results.
61d83fa6-51b5-4331-8d58-269e90c6d395.name: Human Temperature Assessment

alignments.name: Core skills for Work Framework

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the requirement to wear PPE and how to safely put in on
Knowledge of how to use a thermometer correctly to assess human temperature and know the range of temperatures that are normal, identifying individuals with a high temperature
How to implement the report process for abnormal findings
How to discard used supplies, remove gloves and perform hand hygiene
How to conduct disinfection process after use between each person
Understand the factors that influence body temperature

2772f410-4287-4346-ba88-9b3a83a6fbf0.description: Earners of this badge are able to define data analytics and provide them with the skills and knowledge to be able to apply basic data analysis for a range of professional purposes. Earners will be able to use the main tools used for data analysis, outline the function and benefits of data analytics and introduce the process of data analytics for those new to the area.
2772f410-4287-4346-ba88-9b3a83a6fbf0.name: Introduction to Data Analytics

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the fundamental basics of Data Analytics and how it is applied to business operations.
Determine what constitutes useful data, the main questions to be answered, the relevant types of data and the methods of collection
Apply the data analytics process to a defined pool of data and use specific tools to analyse, summarise, visualise and report results.
Investigate a range of tools and dashboards to determine the most suitable software for differing circumstances.

faca3a60-df3f-459a-99d3-a0d325c3a874.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to navigate digital technology used in a vocational education and training (VET) context. They are able to complete basic digital tasks, as well as some tasks that are more complex. Earners can access and use online resources safely, following workplace policies and procedures.
faca3a60-df3f-459a-99d3-a0d325c3a874.name: Digital Literacy for VET teachers

alignments.name: AQF Level 3
alignments.description: Graduates at this level will have theoretical and practical knowledge and skills for work and/or further learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all course modules and interactive activities
Demonstrate the ability to: create and edit a Word document and a spreadsheet; create and send an email
Successfully complete a series of quizzes to demonstrate understanding of digital workplace tools and online safety

77c7ed05-9df6-4a7e-8e82-c8a515003147.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge of what constitutes academic misconduct. They are aware of strategies to avoid plagiarism, collusion and cheating and where to seek support to ensure integrity of their academic work. Earners are aware of the short and long term consequences of academic misconduct.
77c7ed05-9df6-4a7e-8e82-c8a515003147.name: Academic Integrity

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF)
alignments.description: AQF 6 Graduates at this level will have broad knowledge and skills for paraprofessional/highly skilled work and/or further learning.

badge_template_activities.title: This course includes information about Academic integrity and misconduct. It details different types of plagiarism, collusion and cheating and how they can be avoided. The course also includes detail on how and where earners can access support to avoid academic misconduct.

390ed3c3-f097-40b8-93cc-e492c1a26da1.description: Earners of this badge are able to understand and apply the 10 steps required for effective project management. With knowledge of a range of cloud-based tools, the earners are able to select the appropriate tools that match the 10 step project management process.
390ed3c3-f097-40b8-93cc-e492c1a26da1.name: Project Management in the Cloud

badge_template_activities.title: To identify the tasks required for a project with varying requirements.
Explore and evaluate software based tools for the automation of tasks required.
Select a range of suitable tools that align with the tasks required for specific project purposes
Define project objectives and prioritise goals.
Capacity to plan and schedule resources and apply budgets and costing.
Plan, organise, motivate and manage team members. Implement reporting procedures for different types of projects.

1e39bac4-7f0b-408b-ae3b-fb365e2fcebd.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to design and develop contextualised assessment tools. Earners can negotiate the selection of units for development with their manager, organise and conduct a formal validation process, document the required changes in the continuous improvement register and finalise the next version of the resources.
1e39bac4-7f0b-408b-ae3b-fb365e2fcebd.name: Vocational Assessment Skills

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 5
alignments.description: Graduates at this level will apply knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, judgement and defined responsibility in known or changing contexts and within broad but established parameters.

alignments.name: Australian Core Skills Framework Level 4
alignments.description: Accepts new learning challenges, explicitly designing, reflecting on and redesigning approaches to learning as an integral part of the process

badge_template_activities.title: Negotiated with manager to decide which units of competency were developed to meet the business needs of the teaching area. Results recorded in Manager endorsement form.

Designed, developed and validated three assessment tools, including one recognition of prior learning (RPL). Manager confirmed that completed products met the needs of the teaching area and recorded results in Manager 3rd party report.

da14b93a-9f23-4b6a-b4e1-8865062c8a2b.description: Earners of this badge have quickly responded to a changed workplace in a vocational teaching context and demonstrated a positive and agile approach to transition. Earners have implemented the following strategies: development of skills and knowledge in remote communication technologies; providing remote teacher support; facilitating student and employer communication; maintaining compliance requirements and adapting to systems accessed in a remote format.
da14b93a-9f23-4b6a-b4e1-8865062c8a2b.name: Remote Delivery Transition Support

alignments.name: Core skills for work developmental framework

badge_template_activities.title: Develop skills in remote communication technologies including the use of some or all of the following: Student Web, Microsoft Teams, SKYPE for Business, Zoom.
Demonstrate ability to continue performing role in a remote environment.
Demonstrate ability to maintain professional relationships when working in a remote environment.
Endorsement of skill implementation by Dean or Executive Director.

09371cfd-e09a-4288-8e84-2797073a3abb.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to utilise the principles of universal design to support learners with disabilities in vocational education and training (VET). They are able to describe diverse student needs and develop universal design practices to improve accessibility and inclusivity for learners of all abilities.
09371cfd-e09a-4288-8e84-2797073a3abb.name: Universal Design for VET teachers

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 3
alignments.description: Graduates at this level will have theoretical and practical knowledge and skills for work and/or further learning.

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 4
alignments.description: Graduates at this level will have theoretical and practical knowledge and skills for specialised and/or skilled work and/or further learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Reflect on current teaching practice for inclusivity and accessibility in catering for diverse student needs
Brainstorm and present ideas for redesigning aspects of teaching practice using the principles of universal design to support students with disabilities
Document the implementation of a change to teaching practice using the principles of universal design

skills.name: Accessibility And Inclusiveness In Course Design
The Principles Of Universal Design In Education

40d648da-efe6-4fc5-88b7-71553d519f89.description: Earners of this badge can complete a pre-training review according to government guidelines and identify where foundation skills within a training specification or workplace role may form barriers to competence. Earners can design, implement and review practical training and assessment strategies and create digital resources to promote core skill development. Earners have demonstrated an understanding of the ACSF, CsfW and Digital Literacy Skills Frameworks and their uses in the VET sector.
40d648da-efe6-4fc5-88b7-71553d519f89.name: Foundation Skills for VET Practice

alignments.name: TAESS00009 Address Foundation Skills in Vocational Practice Skill Set

badge_template_activities.title: Analysis of learner profiles using externally-developed profiling tool
Analysis of units of competency to identify foundation skills required for success
Analysis of unit plans to identify and discuss where learners’ LLN profiles may cause barriers to success in education and at work.
Document Pre Training reviews
Design, development, implementation and review of four core skill development strategies to help close various core skills gaps in learners
Design, development, implementation and review of two digital resources to help close core skills gaps in learners

0ba59458-43b3-40ba-b557-2525c51f2eca.description: Earners of the Academic Writing badge have demonstrated knowledge of Academic writing, including how and when to reference and how to construct various types of academic texts.
0ba59458-43b3-40ba-b557-2525c51f2eca.name: Academic Writing

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF)
alignments.description: AQF level 6. Graduates at this level will have broad knowledge and skills for paraprofessional/highly skilled work and/or further learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Academic Writing course modules that include academic writing, types of academic writing, structure of essay writing and how to use evidence in an academic context.
Successfully complete a series of quizzes to demonstrate knowledge of academic writing

099ed041-8ebc-489a-89fb-cf340c0ecba9.description: Earners of this badge are able to define what constitutes a cyber-security threat and identify different types of online exposures that may pose a security threat to an organisation. Reasons to protect online identity & personal data are clarified and how to protect an organisation’s data, cyber security awareness practices are identified, concept of cyber threat is defined, the need of cyber security professionals are explained, threat actors, threat vectors and threat goals are clarified
099ed041-8ebc-489a-89fb-cf340c0ecba9.name: Define A Cyber-Security Framework

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the assessment task quiz
Completion of formative learning activity - Define a cyber-security framework for an organisation and the need for cyber security

c92db7c3-eba2-4d7e-9aea-8e87b5252158.description: Earners of this badge are able to identify the presenting risk of family violence. Earners can use effective interpersonal skills to engage sensitively with individuals to facilitate self-disclosure. Earners can identify family violence risk using the MARRAM family violence risk framework. Earners can provide response actions involving making referrals and information sharing to organisations that can provide support to individuals experiencing family violence.
c92db7c3-eba2-4d7e-9aea-8e87b5252158.name: Respond to Family Violence Risk

alignments.name: VU22733 - Identify and provide initial response to family violence risk

badge_template_activities.title: Respond to questions demonstrating knowledge of Mandatory Reporting, Child Safe Standards, inequality, Discrimination, Policy.
Respond to questions related to Family Violence Myths, Family violence drivers, cumulative harm, impact upon Aboriginal communities, Dhelk Dja, Coocurrance of family violence and sexual assault
Demonstrate understanding of the Dhal Dja, its purpose and function.

Successfully complete a role play that requires the student to: Respond to disclosure, Prepare for engagement with the victim survivor, Engage with and inform the service user, Report outcomes and seek assistance,  Debrief and share information, Monitor own personal safety and well-being

06a4abb8-2289-47a0-b015-4def733ce848.description: Earners of this badge have the skills and knowledge to identity common cyber security attacks & techniques that are utilised to infiltrate an organisation. Earners can explain the characteristics and operation of a cyber-attack and identify IoT devices and their security vulnerabilities. Trends of cyber threats are also identified.
06a4abb8-2289-47a0-b015-4def733ce848.name: Identify Cyber Security Attacks

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the assessment task quiz
Completion of formative learning activity - Identify common and emerging cyber security attacks, and techniques

d70c1c8a-de4b-4c43-8c5b-c6048b2e687a.description: Earners of this badge are able to confidently apply the tools of coaching to improve the wellbeing and productivity of themselves and the teams that they manage
d70c1c8a-de4b-4c43-8c5b-c6048b2e687a.name: Coaching Level 1

alignments.name: Victorian Public Service Capability Framework
alignments.description: The Victorian Public Service (VPS) Capability Framework defines the capabilities the VPS workforce requires to achieve it's objectives now and into the future

badge_template_activities.title: Delivery of a coaching session (simulated) to an employee
Capability pre and post self assessment
Coaching log

95ae981f-0645-482a-bbf9-a2e2e458f226.description: Earners of this badge have completed studies in applied research linked to the Boyer Framework of Scholarship. They have completed a research project demonstrating the ability to integrate the elements of the Boyer framework: Discovery to build new knowledge through traditional research; Integration to interpret the use of knowledge across disciplines; Application to help society and professions address problems; Teaching models and practices to achieve optimal learning.
95ae981f-0645-482a-bbf9-a2e2e458f226.name: Applied Research VET Sector

alignments.name: TAERES501 Apply research to training and assessment practice

badge_template_activities.title: Pass a knowledge test on scholarship, applied research and the Boyer framework
Create an annotated bibliography and literature review for a research project
Create and present a research proposal addressing current and future needs of the organisation around training and assessment practice
Review research procedures, methodologies, data collection, analysis and reporting
Report research findings and recommendations

969db68b-4a00-4c64-8028-4c127fd84fa7.description: Earners of this badge are able to document their personal approach to selecting devices and ensuring their data and privacy is protected. Earners will be able to investigate the applications of IoT and consider how you can benefit from the technology and evaluate and understand how IoT plays a role in several different industries and sectors.
969db68b-4a00-4c64-8028-4c127fd84fa7.name: Introduction to Internet of Things

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the fundamental basics of the Internet of Things across several different industries and sectors.
Apply a common analysis process when assessing IoT services and products.
Evaluate and understand how IoT plays a role in topics.
Integrate IoT devices into working life with confidence and clarity.

649ac483-da75-4d44-8129-632bbb1f4754.description: Earners of this badge have the skills to set up digital project files in BIM-capable industry-standard building design drawing software, and produce deliverables through the design and implementation of effective collaborative models. They have acquired the skills for BIM model authoring, documentation, visualisation, virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) concepts and applications. Earner skills also include complex project 3D-modelling, 4D-simulation and 5D-costing.
649ac483-da75-4d44-8129-632bbb1f4754.name: BIM Authoring Skills

alignments.name: 22507VIC - Advanced Diploma of Building Information Modelling (BIM)
alignments.description: The Advanced Diploma of Building Information Modelling (BIM) course provides an accredited training program and vocational outcomes for graduates at para professional level.

badge_template_activities.title: VU22678 Use of Building Information modelling(BIM) Technology for a project.
VU22679 - Use of mixed or blended reality (MR/VR) technologies

adc5d378-2546-48cb-8689-1f7db57c3990.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the erection of three timber prefabricated building systems including CLT, Post and Beam and LVL with cassette floor as per the Australian National Construction Code. Earners have completed one of the practical elements of 22501VIC Course in Onsite installation of Prefabricated Building Systems (Timber)
adc5d378-2546-48cb-8689-1f7db57c3990.name: Installation of Prefabricated Building Systems

alignments.name: FWPTMM3209 Install prefabricated timber building systems on site.
alignments.description: Individuals who complete this micro-credential can continue to complete further units of 22501VIC Course in Prefabricated Building Systems (Timber)

badge_template_activities.title: Earner successfully completed a Knowledge Assessment surrounding the  Prefabricated construction sector.
Earner successfully erected a Cross Laminated Timber (CLT) structure as per the Australian National Construction Code.
Earner successfully erected a hybrid structure consisting of CLT and Glulam Post & Beams as per the Australian National Construction Code.
Earner successfully erected a Laminated Vertical Lumber (LVL) and Cassette Floor structure as per the Australian National Construction Code.

4a3da097-6877-4abe-83b0-8e5213655ee4.description: The earners of this badge have demonstrated excellence in teaching or service delivery that exceeds client/colleague expectations. They have gone above and beyond in demonstrating commitment to clients/colleagues and Box Hill Institute.
4a3da097-6877-4abe-83b0-8e5213655ee4.name: CEO Award for Excellence

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate and actively promote professional excellence in their role/project
Go above and beyond the call of duty, with passion and commitment, to exceed the expectations of their students/clients/colleagues
Act in ways that have a positive impact on Box Hill Institute's achievement of its values, vision or purpose
Ensure ongoing customer/client satisfaction
Lead an initiative, project or program relating to one or more of the key strategic themes, which has a BHI-wide impact

8eb15f1a-9bb2-459b-9d43-69881e1002d8.description: Earners of this badge have the skills to develop a BIM Execution Plan (BEP), including the project goal, BIM uses, stakeholder roles and responsibilities, deliverables for key milestones, and collaboration and integrated project delivery mechanism. They can define the project scope and determine project cost-control parameters, and understand cost data integration in BIM for the project execution. They are knowledgeable about contract models and management strategies using BIM protocol.
8eb15f1a-9bb2-459b-9d43-69881e1002d8.name: BIM Management Skills

alignments.name: 22507VIC - Advanced Diploma of Building Information Modelling (BIM)
alignments.description: The Advanced Diploma of Building Information Modelling (BIM) course provides an accredited training program and vocational outcomes for graduates at para professional level.

badge_template_activities.title: VU22708 Manage project using building information modelling (BIM) technology
VU22714 Manage cost control, planning analysis and control processes
VU22713 Manage building information modelling (BIM) contracts

f45fd3a0-641f-4158-ab24-2b015eb84d13.description: Earners of this badge have participated in a supervised teaching practicum that meets approved teaching qualification standards for AQF levels 5 and 6, as described in the Victorian TAFE Teaching Staff Agreement 2018. This includes 50 hours of being observed teaching in a VET context, 50 hours of observing another teaching in a VET context, and 100 hours of teaching-related activities or completion of three specific units of competence from the TAE50116 Diploma of VET.
f45fd3a0-641f-4158-ab24-2b015eb84d13.name: Teaching Practicum 200 Hours

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 5 and 6
alignments.description: Graduates at this level will have specialised knowledge and skills for skilled/paraprofessional work and/or further learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 50 hours of VET teaching practice being observed by a qualified teacher or teacher supervisor who provides feedback. Record a reflection based on feedback provided with the goal of improving teaching practice and student experience.
Complete 50 hours of observing another VET teacher practice. Provide feedback to the teacher they observed, and record a reflection on how observing the teacher impacts their teaching practice.

Complete 100 hours of teacher activities such as: attendance at meetings or Community of Practice of teachers; development of course materials; student interviews; industry liaison; consultation with external authorities and enterprises. Alternatively, they may have addressed the 100 hours requirement by completing three units: TAEASS501 Provide advanced assessment practice; TAEDEL502 Provide advanced facilitation practice; TAEPDD501 Maintain and enhance professional practice.

67cb6ae1-7d76-4208-9f65-66791b4f5584.description: Earners of this badge are able to confidently apply the tools of coaching to improve the wellbeing and productivity of themselves and the managers that report to them
67cb6ae1-7d76-4208-9f65-66791b4f5584.name: Coaching Level 2

Capability pre and post self assessment
Coaching log

27e9be39-e14a-404c-b77a-f881cac27481.description: Earners of this badge have the skills and knowledge required to deliver e-learning in online and remote learning environments. They are able to design and develop e-learning resources. Earners have a range of specialised, technical and training competences to establish, facilitate, monitor and review e-learning delivered via electronic media.
27e9be39-e14a-404c-b77a-f881cac27481.name: Deliver E-learning Skill Set

alignments.name: TAESS00018 - Deliver E-Learning Skill Set
alignments.description: This skill set addresses the skills and knowledge required to deliver e-learning in online and remote learning environments.

alignments.name: AQF level 5
alignments.description: Graduates at this level will have specialised knowledge and skills for skilled/paraprofessional work and/or further learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the unit 'TAEDES503 Design and develop e-learning resources' by designing and developing two e-learning resources and completing the development of one e-learning resource.

Successfully complete the unit 'TAEDEL501 Facilitate e-learning' by organising and facilitating one complete e-learning program with at least two e-learning activities covering diverse e-learning environments.

skills.name: Ability To Teach In-person Or Remote
Design And Deliver Programs For Online Course

82887f83-cb9b-4211-8375-4984e3f9d06e.description: Earners of this badge have the skills to plan, control and deliver a prefabricated timber building and assembly project using critical path analysis and methodology concepts. They can use complex project monitoring strategies and project evaluation at completion. Earners have successfully completed three units of 22502VIC Diploma of Project Management for Prefabricated Building Systems (Timber).
82887f83-cb9b-4211-8375-4984e3f9d06e.name: Project Management: Prefabricated Buildings 1

alignments.name: 22502VIC - Diploma of Project Management for Prefabricated Building Systems (Timber)

badge_template_activities.title: VU22675 Manage critical path processes for productivity and scheduling of prefabricated building systems
BSBPMG521 Manage project integration
CPCMCM8001 Plan and manage complex projects

f65a6e59-48e4-419f-8801-a098b724302b.description: Earners of this badge have the skills to manage a project using prefabricated timber elements (excluding Class 1) and supervise the systems through which materials are selected, acquired and stored on site for building or construction work, up to and including medium-rise projects. Earners have successfully completed two units of 22502VIC Diploma of Project Management for Prefabricated Building Systems (Timber).
f65a6e59-48e4-419f-8801-a098b724302b.name: Project Management: Prefabricated Buildings 4

alignments.name: 22502VIC - Diploma of Project Management for Prefabricated Building Systems (Timber)

badge_template_activities.title: CPCCBC5004A Supervise and apply quality standards to the selection of building and construction materials
VU22676 Manage prefabricated timber building systems

8e93b0cf-31e7-4129-b1e1-3ffc8b9b4b48.description: Earners of this badge have the skills to use BIM-capable industry-standard software and add value to project deliverables through design and effective collaborative models. They can identify client needs, use BIM tools, identify key stages, performance indicators and scope, collaborate with stakeholders, mitigate risk and establish contingency plans. Earners can problem-solve, implement quality assurance indicators and review the impact of changes in the life of the project.
8e93b0cf-31e7-4129-b1e1-3ffc8b9b4b48.name: BIM Protocol/Process Skills

alignments.name: 22507VIC - Advanced Diploma of Building Information Modelling (BIM)
alignments.description: The Advanced Diploma of Building Information Modelling (BIM) course provides an accredited training program and vocational outcomes for graduates at para professional level.

badge_template_activities.title: VU22709 - Apply benefits of building information modelling (BIM) Technology for a project.
VU22715 - Apply building information modelling (BIM) to validate project performance

093f3d1a-b9da-495b-bc97-af85b9c48085.description: Earners of this badge have skills to build conceptual massing models, perform building performance analysis using energy models and evaluate the life-cycle cost of the project during the operational phase. They can make recommendations to optimise the performance of the building with various design factors, such as orientation, and wall and roof construction. They are knowledgeable about environmentally sustainable design, net-zero-energy building, and carbon-footprint reduction.
093f3d1a-b9da-495b-bc97-af85b9c48085.name: BIM Sustainable Design Skills

alignments.name: 22507VIC - Advanced Diploma of Building Information Modelling (BIM)
alignments.description: The Advanced Diploma of Building Information Modelling (BIM) course provides an accredited training program and vocational outcomes for graduates at para professional level.

badge_template_activities.title: VU22710 Apply sustainable design principles for a BIM project
VU22711 Utilize digital fabrication technology

92617017-b7fa-46df-afd1-1b17ab7bda25.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the knowledge and skills to effectively develop, market and implement a culturally appropriate and sustainable agritourism product. Earners are able to research and design an agritourism product, liaise with stakeholders, analyse the social and economic impact of a product, design and implement sustainable practices, and create marketing activities that support an effective marketing plan.
92617017-b7fa-46df-afd1-1b17ab7bda25.name: Promote and Develop Agritourism

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 5
alignments.description: Graduates at this level will have specialised knowledge and skills for skilled/paraprofessional work and/or further learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the unit 'SITTPPD008 Develop tourism products' by developing and implementing a product development plan for a new agritourism product
Successfully complete the unit 'SITTPPD010 Develop culturally appropriate tourism operations' by developing and implementing a culturally appropriate agritourism operation plan
Successfully complete the unit 'BSBMKG414 Undertake marketing activities' by developing, documenting and implementing marketing activities for an agritourism product

1a248cde-2f27-407f-a2be-5bf452c4deaa.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a commitment to support teachers under supervision completing TAE40116 Certificate IV in Training and Assessment. As mentors in a formal mentoring program, earners have actively participated in a mentoring community of practice, observed the teaching practice of mentees, provided coaching in quality teaching practice and maintained compliance documentation.
1a248cde-2f27-407f-a2be-5bf452c4deaa.name: Teaching Excellence Mentor

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework
Australian Core Skills Framework

badge_template_activities.title: Maintain a positive and effective mentor relationship with the mentee
Observe session delivery of teacher under supervision, offer constructive feedback and maintain records
Support the mentee to navigate workplace systems and procedures

4638ae1f-7c85-4144-96c7-0daeaafa245b.description: Earners of this badge have the skills to set up digital project files in building information modelling (BIM) software. They are able to design and implement effective collaborative models, and have experience visualising and manipulating interactive project information superimposed across real and virtual realities. Earners have successfully completed three units of 22502VIC Diploma of Project Management for Prefabricated Building Systems (Timber).

VU22679 Use mixed or blended reality technologies

860ec5d5-9279-424c-af73-f8b37ba92088.description: Earners of this badge have the skills to follow OH&S requirements and safe work practice while undertaking tasks within the construction sector. They are able to read and interpret plans and specifications relevant to construction operations, with a view to determine and apply relevant codes and standards for prefabricated timber buildings (excluding Class 1). Earners have successfully completed three units of 22502VIC Diploma of Project Management for Prefabricated Building Systems (Timber).

CPCCCM2001A Read and Interpret plans and specifications
VU22677 – Apply building codes and standards for prefabricated timber building systems

ba290d93-e1bc-444e-bf7f-e22122e9163d.description: The earners of this badge have demonstrated individual excellence in teaching or service delivery that contributed to the vision, purpose, values and strategic initiatives of Box Hill Institute.
ba290d93-e1bc-444e-bf7f-e22122e9163d.name: CEO Commendation for Individual Excellence

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate professional excellence in their role/project
Work with passion and commitment to enhance services to  students/clients/colleagues
Contribute to Box Hill Institute's achievement of its values, vision or purpose
Ensure ongoing customer/client satisfaction through professionalism and positivity
Contribute significantly to an initiative, project or program relating to one or more of the key strategic themes, which has a BHI-wide impact

3718d075-0f93-40f4-88dc-f571cc0ff51a.description: Earners of this badge have gained knowledge and skills on being familiar with the concept and understanding of data. They can identify the fundamentals of statistics, and are able to understand how statistics relate to using data. Earners can also recognise the different methods used to present data and how they can be used in decision making processes
3718d075-0f93-40f4-88dc-f571cc0ff51a.name: Data Literacy

alignments.name: Core Skills for Work Development Framework
alignments.description: The Core Skills for Work Developmental describes a set of non-technical skills, knowledge and understandings that underpin successful participation in work. These skills are often referred to as employability or generic skills and include skills such as problem solving, collaboration, self-management, communication and information technology skills

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all course modules and interactive activities
Successfully complete a series of quizzes to demonstrate understanding of data literacy

9a93d942-c518-49a3-a8e7-d92412416892.description: Earners of this badge have gained knowledge and skills to develop a range of transferable skills across a variety of digital platforms and understand how to supervise their digital footprint. They have identified different technology tools and software, learnt about identifying and organising date, creating content using tips and tricks, and the importance of digital maintenance and how one of the best ways to remain digitally literate is to be able to solve digital problems.
9a93d942-c518-49a3-a8e7-d92412416892.name: Digital Literacy

670c4a57-94c4-4a22-9fb4-8fc4d80831e6.description: Earners of this badge are able to effectively interact with their work team, customers, management and other stakeholders through use of different communication methods and recognise and overcome communication barriers. Earners will be familiar with encoding and decoding messages and providing clear and concise feedback
670c4a57-94c4-4a22-9fb4-8fc4d80831e6.name: Communication

9691f8f3-dc56-4675-b2d9-7bd4ad2c0e8d.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to analyse information objectively and make judgments. Information that is analysed may include data, facts and research findings. Earners are able to encourage others to develop innovative solutions to organsational issues through ideation methods and identify knowledge gaps and support learning
9691f8f3-dc56-4675-b2d9-7bd4ad2c0e8d.name: Critical Thinking

ea34c729-67a6-4340-8b32-51c04459a0cc.description: Earners of this badge have attained the knowledge to identify, assess and clarify customer service through effective communication techniques and provide quality customer service and satisfaction. Identify professional attributes of quality staff, understand stakeholder requirements analysis - who are they, what impact/influence do they have and how to communicate with them. Follow basic customer service principles and protocols and be familiar with innovative technology
ea34c729-67a6-4340-8b32-51c04459a0cc.name: Customer Experience

2fb38504-1cc8-46c2-9e90-a5ff43b20358.description: Earners of this badge will have an understanding of what is involved with the development of and implementation of strategic plans that enables long-term success. They will be able to review and/or develop organisational values and analyse the organisations's strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats in order to maintain a competitive advantage. Earners have learnt how to research, identity and consider strengths and weaknesses of existing and potential competitors and allies
2fb38504-1cc8-46c2-9e90-a5ff43b20358.name: Driving Strategic Results

95271e11-04f4-4233-9dee-ff5ae753fc54.description: Earners of this badge have gained the knowledge and skills by focusing on the fundamentals of establishing a new business entity, intending to make profit. Topics covered include business basics, legal requirements, contracts, business risk, compliance, operations, policies and procedures
95271e11-04f4-4233-9dee-ff5ae753fc54.name: Entrepreneurship

4c7b661a-7222-4c7f-a8c7-a72df7dd1ceb.description: Earners of this badge are able to implement strategies employed to defend an organisation against cyber security attacks and identify techniques to protect personal devices from cyber threats. Mitigation strategies such as the cyber kill chain process, the MITRE ATT&CK in the context of cyber security protection are explained and incident response policies, processes and systems are reviewed. Fundamentals of NIST CSF are examined and explained.
4c7b661a-7222-4c7f-a8c7-a72df7dd1ceb.name: Implement Methods To Protect Data

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the assessment task quiz
Completion of formative learning activity -Implement methods to protect private and organisation data

skills.name: Fundamentals of The National Institute of Standards & Technology (NIST)

18404fbd-a3ae-47e0-a20a-660728c4d279.description: Earners of this badge will have the knowledge and skills for developing organisational objectives and designing operational diversity plans using various tools like SWOT analysis and Gantt charts. They will also be able to demonstrate clear leadership values by example and provide employee support and recognition to enhance performance, development and motivation
18404fbd-a3ae-47e0-a20a-660728c4d279.name: Leading and Developing Others

6ec82fab-642a-4987-8a63-7be41ac9de05.description: Earners of this badge will have the knowledge and skills to manage their own motivation, establish work performance planning and set and meet work priorities through setting clear and concise goals to track progress and successes. ea0cd890-4127-466c-8c6a-4e603afc65c4.description: Earners of this badge will have the knowledge and skills to practice and enforce the code of ethics and focus on being a corporate leader by example. They have a good understanding of the importance of workplace relationships, professionalism, professional improvement, always ask questions, team building, understanding conflict and resolution, developing respect from within the work organisation and the difference between micromanaging versus macromanaging
ea0cd890-4127-466c-8c6a-4e603afc65c4.name: Thought Leadership
